42535.name: Canals (Isard (1942))
42535.description: Measures the mileage of completed canals.

source.name: Isard (1942) and others

42536.name: Roads (US Census Bureau (2017))
42536.description: Total surface mileage in thousands of miles.

source.name: Isard (1942) and others

42537.name: Diesel locomotives in service (US Census Bureau (2017))
42537.description: Number of diesel locomotives in service.

source.name: Isard (1942) and others

42538.name: Agricultural tractor (Comin and Hobijn (2004))
42538.description: Number of wheel and crawler tractors (excl. garden tractors) used in agriculture

source.name: Isard (1942) and others

42539.name: ATM (Comin and Hobijn (2004))
42539.description: Number of electro-mechanical devices that permit authorized users, typically using machine readable plastic cards, to withdraw cash from their accounts and/or access other services

source.name: Isard (1942) and others

42540.name: Aviation passenger-km (Comin and Hobijn (2004))
42540.description: Civil aviation passenger‐km travelled on scheduled services by companies registered in the country concerned. Not a measure of travel through a country’s airports

source.name: Isard (1942) and others

42541.name: Credit and debit payments (Comin and Hobijn (2004))
42541.description: Payments by credit and debit cards (in millions)

source.name: Isard (1942) and others

42542.name: Card payments (Comin and Hobijn (2004))
42542.description: Number of transactions using payment cards at points of service (retail locations)

source.name: Isard (1942) and others

42543.name: Mail (Mitchell (1998))
42543.description: Number of items mailed/received, with internal items counted one and cross border items counted once for each country. May or may not include newspapers sent by mail, registered mail, or parcel post (in millions)

source.name: Isard (1942) and others

42544.name: MRI units (Comin and Hobijn (2004))
42544.description: Number of magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) units

source.name: Isard (1942) and others

42545.name: Newspapers (Comin and Hobijn (2004))
42545.description: Number of newspaper copies circulated daily. Note that there is a tendency for news circulation to be under‐reported, since data for weekly and biweekly publications are not included.

source.name: Isard (1942) and others

42546.name: Retail locations accepting card (Comin and Hobijn (2004))
42546.description: Number of retail locations at which payment cards can be used.

source.name: Isard (1942) and others

42547.name: Rail passenger-km (Comin and Hobijn (2004))
42547.description: Passenger journeys by railway in passenger‐km. Free passengers typically excluded but may be included for some countries

source.name: Isard (1942) and others

42548.name: Steamships (tons) (Comin and Hobijn (2004))
42548.description: Tonnage of steam ships (above a minimum weight) in use at midyear

source.name: Isard (1942) and others

42549.name: Crude steel production (blast oxygen furnaces) (Comin and Hobijn (2004))
42549.description: Crude steel production (in metric tons) in blast oxygen furnaces (a process that replaced Bessemer and OHF processes)

source.name: Isard (1942) and others

42550.name: Crude steel production (electric furnaces) (Comin and Hobijn (2004))
42550.description: Crude steel production (in metric tons) in electric arc furnaces (a process that complemented and improved upon Bessemer and OHF processes)

source.name: Isard (1942) and others

42551.name: Telegrams (Mitchell (1998))
42551.description: Number of telegrams sent, in millions

source.name: Isard (1942) and others

42552.name: Synthetic (non-cellulosic) fibres (Comin and Hobijn (2004))
42552.description: Weight of synthetic (non‐cellulosic) fibres used in spindles

source.name: Isard (1942) and others

42553.name: Commercial vehicles (Comin and Hobijn (2004))
42553.description: Number of commercial vehicles, typically including buses and taxis (excluding tractors and similar vehicles), in use. Numbers typically derived from) registration and licensing records, meaning that vehicles out of use may occasionally be included

source.name: Isard (1942) and others
